Package problem01.model

Interface IValidateInput

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ValidateInput
    public interface IValidateInput
    Interface describing the public functionality of a ValidateInput object, comprising of the ability to check various CLI arguments for validity.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.String checkCSV()
      Checks that the command line arguments contain a --csv-file flag and a path/to/file.
      void checkFollowingArg​(java.lang.Integer i, java.lang.String currentArg, java.lang.String missingArg)
      Checks that where a filename or folder name is required after an argument, that path is provided
      void checkNoTask​(java.lang.Boolean add, java.lang.Boolean complete, java.lang.Boolean display)
      Method used to ensure that at least one of the tree tasks is performed.

    • Method Detail

      • checkCSV

        java.lang.String checkCSV()
                   throws InvalidArgumentException
        Checks that the command line arguments contain a --csv-file flag and a path/to/file.
        Returns:
        - returns the csv path/to/file provided
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - - thrown if missing one or both of the --csv-file flag and path/to/file.

      • checkNoTask

        void checkNoTask​(java.lang.Boolean add,
                 java.lang.Boolean complete,
                 java.lang.Boolean display)
          throws InvalidArgumentException
        Method used to ensure that at least one of the tree tasks is performed. If no task args were provided, throws an exception
        Parameters:
        add - - whether add task args are present
        complete - - whether complete task args are present
        display - - whether display task args are present
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - - thrown if arguments are found to be invalid

      • checkFollowingArg

        void checkFollowingArg​(java.lang.Integer i,
                       java.lang.String currentArg,
                       java.lang.String missingArg)
                throws InvalidArgumentException
        Checks that where a filename or folder name is required after an argument, that path is provided
        Parameters:
        i - - position in array of args to check
        currentArg - - current argument being parsed
        missingArg - - the following argument that may be missing
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - - thrown if the path following a template flag is missing
